info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:24PM EDT until April 9 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Salt River at Shepherdsville affecting Bullitt County.
.Heavy rain from the past week caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Salt River at Shepherdsville.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Water covers low spot of KY 61 at north end of bridge. At 33.0 feet, Corner of First and Buckman Street north of bridge flood. At 35.0 feet, Water covers several low roads near river. At 36.0 feet, Access road into Frank E. Simon park floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 36.0 feet and slowly falling. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Monday was 36.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning and continue falling to 16.5 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.9 feet on 02/26/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by early Tuesday afternoon.Tuesday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
